Reviews.Content: Just lovely! Our family (two parents and two college-aged children) just returned from a trip to Italy. Our daughter finished a semester studying in Florence and we met her there to begin our trip. We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Principe where we were greeted warmly and made to feel at home right away.  Our rooms were lovely - one overlooking the charming garden and one with a balcony facing the river. Both bedrooms and the private bathrooms were clean and well decorated with nice touches such as a heated towel rack in the bathroom. Breakfast was a treat in the beautifully appointed dining room, with gracious service and a good selection of food on the buffet.  Any questions we had or requests we made were handled promptly and graciously. We left the Hotel Principe to travel through Italy, but returned at the end of our trip for 2 more nights. It was like coming home. Once again we were greeted with smiles and warmth.  On both of our stays we found the location to be very good. We walked to the Duomo and other important sites in the city, as well as sites along the river including the Ponte Vecchio and Oltrarno. We walked to everything including wonderful restaurants!  We highly recommend a stay at the Hotel Principe.
Reviews.Author: tantetravels

Reviews.Content: I love Hotel Principe I recently spent some time in Florence on a vacation with friends.We stayed at Hotel Principe, as my good friend spends a lot of time in Italy on business and has always raved about this hotel.Needless to say , I was not at all disappointed. Not only was the staff and family absolutely charming and professional, but they upgraded our room , so we had a beautiful suite with a view of the river..... one of the best experiences I had in Italy to date ! For those wanting to avoid trendy, impersonal service, this hotel is a must. All class, and beautiful too!
Reviews.Author: wasabidanish

Reviews.Content: Best experience, amazing service I stayed there for three days out of my thirteen day travel of Italy, and this was by far the most amazing service and hospitality I experienced. I originally chose this hotel because it was closest to the American Counselate, and I was in a situation with a temporarily-lost family member. I am so glad It happened to be the one I found because I couldn't have found a better choice. All the staff went out of there way at every chance they had to help me. Especially the manager and the young man who worked at the front desk. It was like a home away from home, everyone was so very accomadating and wonderful. Not to mention the hotel is beautiful, like old-country Italy style. The view is right over the water with a nice balcony, a gorgeous sight with ducks and beavers swimming around. The housekeeping was very thorough, detail oriented, and so friendly. Breakfast was served in a beautiful antique inspired room, with white gloved coffee/ espresso service. The artwork, the old-fashioned furniture and decor was so beautiful. Set in a convenient location close to the strain station and nice restaurants, yet off the main streets to give it a more authentic old town experience. I plan to go back to this hotel when I visit Italy again. I definetely recommend this hotel if you find you're planning to visit Florence.
Reviews.Author: tina1225

Reviews.Content: Great hotel We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights.Yhe atmosphere there is fantastic. The hotel is comfotable and pleasent. The crew is kind and worm and makes the stay there very pleasent.The location is very good, about 5 to 15 minutes walk from every important location in the city + it is located just on the river.Would definitely go back if I viit Florence again.
Reviews.Author: DumboG

Reviews.Content: Great location and view The Principe's big plusses are a beautiful interior, great views from the roof and most of the rooms, very nice staff, and a safe 10 minute walk to most central Florence attractions. Check the hotel's website (easily found via Google) as I found some good deals posted there.A few cautionary notes:The hotel is inside the ZTL/restricted driving zone, but offers free parking to guests and will clear your license plate with the police on your arrival. However they will only do this once, so *do not* stay at this hotel if you need to use your car at all.The breakfast was sparse and mediocre quality so if this is your meal plan on one of the local cafes (5-10 minutes walk).Internet is available but is pay-for-use (20 euros for 24 total hours I believe).While it's wonderful being right on the Arno, plan for mosquitos most times of year.
Reviews.Author: CAByFoot

Reviews.Content: The Principe was Magnificent! My family and I stayed at the Principe in mid July 2008, and our stay was outstanding. Giuliano Nissi, the proprietor and his excellent staff made us feel most welcome and accommodated our visit in every way. We will most definitely stay at the Principe on our next visit to Florence. We highly recommend this hotel!
Reviews.Author: Chicago4Chicago_IL

Reviews.Content: really nice We stayed here for our 25th wedding anniversary and booked a standard double room through airmiles. On arrival we were allocated a room with terrace overlooking the Arno, which was a lovely surprise. The hotel decor was quite dated and our room was a little shabby although spotlessly clean; we stayed for 4 nights and the bed linen was changed twice! In the evenings the bed was turned down and the curtains were drawn while we were out.The breakfast was fabulous and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic and the view from the rooftop terrace is beautiful.
Reviews.Author: bethmacmum

Reviews.Content: Excellent Old Style Hotel We stayed in the Principe for one night and were very impressed.It's ideally located close to the city centre and also overlooking the river. It also has car parking, which is a big plus. The owners were incredibly welcoming and friendly. We were offered the choice of two rooms, which we were shown. What other hotels would do this? The first room with a river view was very small but the second room with the garden view was much bigger and had amazing old fashioned decor and a warm feel to it. We opted for the larger room as they were the same price (the smaller room really was very small!!!). I was also allowed to use their computer to surf the internet for no charge (again, main stream hotels would charge for this privilege) . The breakfast was included and was simple enough, but then again Italians don't really do breakfast. Again, however the service was warm and friendly and couldn't be fautled. The air conditioning in the rooms was excellent, which was a major plus given the temperatures outside. The hotel had a lovely dated feel to it and the decor and paintings, etc, make you feel like you're in old Italy, and are very much in keeping with the ambience of Florence.
Reviews.Author: Diarmaid

Reviews.Content: A Home in Florence I have just returned from 15 days in Florence and Tuscany. I stayed at the Hotel Principe for 8 nights. This was my second time at the Principe and I highly recommend it. It is ideally located, includes beautiful views of the Arno and is surrounded by a wonderful walled garden. Most importantly, this family run establishment welcomes you into their home. Rooms, furnishings, and staff make you feel like a guest at an old palace. I highly recommend this hotel for the total experience and for a good value.
Reviews.Author: BellaItaliana

Reviews.Content: A This is the most magnificent hotel-villa along the Arno to stay in Florence! The owners will welcome you like family and treat you as royalty. You will love the room, gardens, location ... Don't miss this jewel!! The owners are a family and they are willing to share all the history of the villa which dates from1850 and was built for the Kings mistress. Enjoy!!!
Reviews.Author: marcia26

Reviews.Content: Highly recommended hotel . Family run, well suitated in the city of Florence We were booked into the Hotel Principe by Airmiles and were so glad that they made this booking for us. Our total stay in Florence was 10 days so it gave us a good opportunity to judge the hotel. Firstly it was really good to stay in a small hotel owned by an Italian family rather than a large international hotel . The owners and staff went out of there way to make our stay a great experience. The hotel was friendly, very clean and comfortable. Florence is a buzzing typically noisy city, the hotel is nicely located on the River Arno and we can highly recommend the rooms overlooking the garden to the rear of the hotel which gave some degree of tranquillity from the city noises even with the windows open. Amenities such as rail and coach terminals, plus city centre and all facilities e.g. shopping, restaurants and sight seeing were all within walking distance. This hotel only provides bed and breakfast facilities (breakfast good choice for all cultures). We can highly recommend this hotel for a wonderful stay in the beautiful city of Florence.
Reviews.Author: equhart

Reviews.Content: Wonderful Service at a Great Hotel We have just returned from our trip to Italy, and staying at the Hotel Principe made our visit to Florence a superior experience. Every staff member we encountered went out of their way to help. When asked tourist type questions, they not only gave the answer, but also provided similar options and services. Again, the staff is 5 star.Staying at this hotel, a traveler can experience what it was like in Florence in the 18th Century. Authentic period rooms, furnished with period pieces. Just what my husband and I wanted for our stay.Bathroom was magnificent, bigger than large, with luxury towels. Breakfast was wonderful having a continental breakfast that includes eggs if requested. The only drawback we found (not the hotel's fault) was the smoking. As this hotel is small, non-smoking floors don't exist. Guests should know ahead of time that the quests in the adjoining suite might smoke, and there is nothing that can be done, even if you requested a non-smoking room.Overall, a great experience. My husband and I recommend this hotel to travelers who want to experience Florence as it was, with the added bonus of staff who are willing to go the distance to make your stay great.
Reviews.Author: chtddrzy

Reviews.Content: beautiful small hotel and location After spotting this lovely hotel on a previous trip to Florence, we decided we had to stay at Principe the next trip. It's just wonderful. It's right on the Arno, but away from the Ponte Vecchio, so it's a quieter neighborhood. You can still walk practically everywhere if you are there to see the museums, etc.The staff is attentive and will suggest the best restaurants, not the tourist traps. The room is decked out in pretty antique furnishings and is oh so comfortable. If you liked A Room with a View, and want to come close to this experience, this might just be it.
Reviews.Author: scullywebb

Reviews.Content: Must Stay Here Stayed here with my boyfriend for 2 nights. Amazing location, easy walk to the city centre, great view on the river, easy to get to from the main train station.It is a family run hotel and the owners are so friendly and helpful. They recommended a great pizza place a few streets away which was delicious! Big rooms, nice bathroom, really comfortable, had 2 balconies!Breakfast was included in the rate and was great. As well as the buffet they cooked you omlettes and fried eggs if you wanted!I would definitely recommend this hotel and would go back in a minute!!
Reviews.Author: clobella

Reviews.Content: Principe made our stay in Italy the best!! My wife and I stayed in Florence for about 10 days (in two chunks) during our 3 weeks in Italy. This hotel was the best. Great room with a view of the river (beautiful at night), great breakfast, good value, clean, and so on. The hotel is family run and has a classic Italy feel - warm and friendly. But what really made it stand out was the Staff. They were always very helpful in taking care of our needs, recommendations for restaurants, booking mseums and wine tours - even helped us understand the train reservations. One of the highlihts of our trip was the evenings we spent sitting with Giuliano in the lobby drinking wine or cappuccinos and talking about the history of the hotel and life in Italy. When we return to Italy we will definitly be staying here again.
Reviews.Author: KentCampbell

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with a warm family atmosphere We spent three nights at the Principe in Florence during our vacation in Italy. The hotel is nice and quaint, right on the river, and about a 10 minute walk from town. The staff was incredibly friendly and warm. While the hotel is a little old, it was very clean, the rooms are very large and spacious (especially when compared to the size of other rooms in Italian hotels) and the price was good. Most of all, the service was exceptional. They really do try to help their guests with their needs. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we stayed in on our holiday in Italy.
Reviews.Author: DUSNj

Reviews.Content: Nice Old Hotel with Great Service We stayed here for two nights and found it just by driving by. I agree with another reviewer that it's a bit old and faded with a musty smell in the room. But it was very clean and the price was goodgiven the amazing location (right by the river with walking distance to the center) Most of all, the service was wonderful. The gentleman at the font desk brought me am English paper in the morning and gave us lots of help with maps and directions. Breakfast was good with free omelets which was a nice touch. The hotel has a small parking lot at the back and they will help you drive in. This is rare in Florence and very nice! They even let us keep our car there the day we checked out. I think this was a very lucky find and I recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: GaryGilchrist

Reviews.Content: Our Home Away From Home A friend of ours stays at Hotel Principe in Florence quite regularly, and so she highly recommended this hotel to us. It is situated right on the Arno River and has beautiful views - especially if you go up to the roof and enjoy their rooftop patio! They also have a serene garden out back. The building itself is stunning with frescos on the ceilings in many of the rooms and intricate antique furniture. A prince built this villa for his mistress long ago. Each room is different - we stayed in the room that the prince used to stay in when he would come to visit. The hospitality and service are top notch. They made us feel like a part of the family. A wonderful buffet breakfast was served for us every morning - ask for a cappucino, they are the best! The hotel is situated close to everything, but just a little bit off the main drag, which makes it peaceful and quiet. Feel the romance of Florence at this unique and worldly villa.
Reviews.Author: donnamdee

Reviews.Content: run down Good location- right on the Arno and walkable to everything.  We ended up with a very large room with an extra sitting room (comparable to a suite). The main issues with this hotel are that it is very smokey and the furniture is old and musty. I could smell smoke as soon as I walked into the lobby and requested a smoke free room. The gentleman at the desk pointed to the sign on the desk - a cigarette with an X through it. The first room we were given smelled as if someone had just put out a cigarette. The second room was better. My husband walked into the lobby area early the next morning to find the man at the desk smoking. The furniture is grand and old, however I didn't want my skin to touch any of the cloth covered couches etc... it just seemed musty and run down. Beautiful courtyard in the back. Large, nice bathroom, however the water pressure was very low.
Reviews.Author: JKQ

Reviews.Content: Loved this Classic Jewel of Florence: Hotel Principe We were extremely fortunate to have stayed at the Hotel Principe in Florence, Italy this summer. The Hotel Principe, a four-star hotel that is family-owned and run, sits on the Arno River two bridges down from the Ponte Vecchio. It is a charming establishment with old world charm and grace. High ceilings, airy sitting rooms, fabulous straight-on river views, immaculate quarters, lovely private garden and scenery viewing deck on the roof combine to give the guest a sense of welcome security....a home to return to after a tiring day of trying to see all the amazing masterpieces in Firenze. Our room was very large and included a nicely furnished sitting area and wall hangings that are a signature of Tuscany. It had a large window that opened out on the Arno River with amazing views of Florence: the Ponte Vecchio to the left, the Pitti Palace and the Cahedral across the river (that we couldn't get into), the beautiful countryside in the distance on the right. The sunsets were wonderful. Breakfast was served in a beautiful dining room and every attempt was made by the staff to provide us with whatever we requested, such as eggs prepared to order. We received excellent suggestions for restaurants and tips for sightseeing from the staff. We found its location to be ideal, within walking distance of...well, everything! We were grateful that it was not situated on an inner-street for we found those to be dark and somewhat noisy. Our hotel is about a block away from the Grand Hotel Continental and the Westin-Excelsior and for less than half the price of staying in those hotels, we had a bigger room, the best view possible and a place that is molte familiare (forgive my spelling), classy with old world charm minus the ostentation of the nouveau poseur hotels. We look forward to returning to the Hotel Principe on our next trip to Florence....there is so much to see and absorb.. .We should mention that we were made to feel most welcome by the owner and his daughter as well as the reception staff. They have imbued the hotel with their warmth and sincerity and it will be our pleasure to return.
Reviews.Author: Lovesalbert

Reviews.Content: Warm and friendly and beautiful interior decor My husband and myself were part of a large group there for a medical conference. The hotel is beautifully decorated with paintings on the ceiling, nice landscaping and the room is spacious as well. It's unique in the sense that it has a history to it. Apparently it was built for the King's wife/mistress. It's a family-run hotel, and Anna, the owner of the hotel is a warm and friendly person who made all of us feel at home although we were 10,000 km away from home. The good thing about the hotel is that it is centrally located along the river, not far from the pointe vecchio. You are easilly accessible to the 24-hour kebab shops for late nite snacks. Had a great and enjoyable stay in florence and hotel principe contributed to it as well. Thanks Anna, Giovanna, Giuliano and Beatrice for making our stay in Florence/ Firenze a wonderful one.Hanis from Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
Reviews.Author: Hanis2505

Reviews.Content: Excellent base in Florence My husband and I booked the hotel direct for two nights having read a positive review in the Cadogan Guide.We were expecting a pleasant stay but thought perhaps the service would be a little impersonal as in most city hotels.We were wrong.The hotel is very comfortable, the breakfast first rate- a really good choice ,and courteously served. My husband's omelette was cooked to order and he was asked if he would like prosciutto with it.!!The reception staff could not have been more helpful and friendly and we were lucky enough to meet the delightful owner who told us the story of this historic building.Thoroughly recommended
Reviews.Author: ALBANY

Reviews.Content: Charming Hotel! We loved this hotel! It was so charming! The staff was excellent. The concierge recommended some fabulous restaurants!! Our room had a great view of the river and beautiful Florence!! I would definitely stay there again. The location was good, we were able to walk everywhere.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel My husband and I have been to Florence several times but this was our first stay at the Principe, directly across from the Arno River. The staff was very pleasant and helpful with suggestions and directions. We stayed in a 2 room suite for a very good rate, with a private balcony and an unobstructed view of the Arno River. The rooms were immaculate and breakfast was good. It's the 3rd bridge down from the Ponte Vecchio so it's about a 10 min. walk to the center of the historic area. This is the only reason I gave it a rating of 4 instead of 5.
Reviews.Author: S.Cool

Reviews.Content: Il piacere dell'accoglienza   showReview(22241953, 'full');
Reviews.Author: tatamilano

Reviews.Content: 銈广偪銉冦儠銇蹇溿伅鏈€楂樸仹銇欍€?#x201d;   showReview(19172711, 'full');
